trans-unit.source: iOS policy settings | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: iOS policy settings | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Create policies that control settings and features on iOS devices that you manage with Intune.
trans-unit.target: Create policies that control settings and features on iOS devices that you manage with Intune.

trans-unit.source: iOS policy settings in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: iOS policy settings in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Intune supplies a range of built-in general settings that you can configure on iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: Intune supplies a range of built-in general settings that you can configure on iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can use the Apple Configurator tool to create custom settings that are not available from Intune.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can use the Apple Configurator tool to create custom settings that are not available from Intune.

trans-unit.source: General configuration policy settings
trans-unit.target: General configuration policy settings

trans-unit.source: Use the Microsoft Intune **iOS general configuration policy** to configure settings for:
trans-unit.target: Use the Microsoft Intune **iOS general configuration policy** to configure settings for:

trans-unit.source: **General device, and security settings**.
trans-unit.target: **General device, and security settings**.

trans-unit.source: Choose from a list of predefined settings that let you control a range of features and functionality on the device.
trans-unit.target: Choose from a list of predefined settings that let you control a range of features and functionality on the device.

trans-unit.source: **Kiosk mode**.
trans-unit.target: **Kiosk mode**.

trans-unit.source: Lock a device to allow only certain features to work.
trans-unit.target: Lock a device to allow only certain features to work.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can allow a device to run only one managed app that you specify, or you can disable the volume buttons on a device.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can allow a device to run only one managed app that you specify, or you can disable the volume buttons on a device.

trans-unit.source: These settings might be used for a demonstration model of a device, or a device that is dedicated to performing only one function, such as a point-of-sale device.
trans-unit.target: These settings might be used for a demonstration model of a device, or a device that is dedicated to performing only one function, such as a point-of-sale device.

trans-unit.source: **Compliant and noncompliant apps**.
trans-unit.target: **Compliant and noncompliant apps**.

trans-unit.source: Specify a list of apps that are compliant or not compliant in your company.
trans-unit.target: Specify a list of apps that are compliant or not compliant in your company.

trans-unit.source: On Android and iOS devices, the **Noncompliant Apps Report** can be used to view the compliance of apps that you specified in the list against the apps that users have installed (but cannot actually block the installation of the app).
trans-unit.target: On Android and iOS devices, the **Noncompliant Apps Report** can be used to view the compliance of apps that you specified in the list against the apps that users have installed (but cannot actually block the installation of the app).

trans-unit.source: You can configure terms and conditions for users to ensure that they acknowledge that apps on their device (including personal apps) will be evaluated, and noncompliant apps will be either blocked or reported as noncompliant.
trans-unit.target: You can configure terms and conditions for users to ensure that they acknowledge that apps on their device (including personal apps) will be evaluated, and noncompliant apps will be either blocked or reported as noncompliant.

trans-unit.source: Users must accept these terms and conditions before they can enroll their device and use the company portal to get apps.
trans-unit.target: Users must accept these terms and conditions before they can enroll their device and use the company portal to get apps.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using terms and conditions, see [Terms and conditions policy settings in Microsoft Intune](terms-and-condition-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about using terms and conditions, see [Terms and conditions policy settings in Microsoft Intune](terms-and-condition-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: If the setting you are looking for does not appear in this topic, you might be able to create it by using an iOS custom policy that lets you import settings you created by using the [Apple Configurator tool](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator/id434433123?mt=12).
trans-unit.target: If the setting you are looking for does not appear in this topic, you might be able to create it by using an iOS custom policy that lets you import settings you created by using the [Apple Configurator tool](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator/id434433123?mt=12).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see "Custom policy settings" later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see "Custom policy settings" later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Security settings
trans-unit.target: Security settings

trans-unit.source: All settings apply to iOS 8.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: All settings apply to iOS 8.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Require a password to unlock mobile devices
trans-unit.target: Require a password to unlock mobile devices

trans-unit.source: Specify whether the user is required to enter a password to access their device.
trans-unit.target: Specify whether the user is required to enter a password to access their device.

trans-unit.source: Required password type
trans-unit.target: Required password type

trans-unit.source: Specify the type of password that will be required, such as numeric only or alphanumeric.
trans-unit.target: Specify the type of password that will be required, such as numeric only or alphanumeric.

trans-unit.source: Number of complex characters required in password
trans-unit.target: Number of complex characters required in password

trans-unit.source: Specify the number of symbol characters (like **#** or **@**) that must be included in the password.
trans-unit.target: Specify the number of symbol characters (like **#** or **@**) that must be included in the password.

trans-unit.source: Minimum password length
trans-unit.target: Minimum password length

trans-unit.source: Specify the minimum number of characters in the password.
trans-unit.target: Specify the minimum number of characters in the password.

trans-unit.source: Allow simple passwords
trans-unit.target: Allow simple passwords

trans-unit.source: Allow simple passwords like **0000** and **1234**.
trans-unit.target: Allow simple passwords like **0000** and **1234**.

trans-unit.source: Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped
trans-unit.target: Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped

trans-unit.source: Specify the number of failed login attempts before this setting wipes the device.
trans-unit.target: Specify the number of failed login attempts before this setting wipes the device.

trans-unit.source: **Minutes of inactivity before password is required**<sup>1
trans-unit.target: **Minutes of inactivity before password is required**<sup>1

trans-unit.source: Specify how long the device can remain idle before the user must re-enter their password.
trans-unit.target: Specify how long the device can remain idle before the user must re-enter their password.

trans-unit.source: Password expiration (days)
trans-unit.target: Password expiration (days)

trans-unit.source: Specify the number of days before the device password must be changed.
trans-unit.target: Specify the number of days before the device password must be changed.

trans-unit.source: Remember password history
trans-unit.target: Remember password history

trans-unit.source: Specify whether the user can use passwords that they have previously used.
trans-unit.target: Specify whether the user can use passwords that they have previously used.

trans-unit.source: **Remember password history** – **Prevent reuse of previous passwords**
trans-unit.target: **Remember password history** – **Prevent reuse of previous passwords**

trans-unit.source: Specify the number of previously used passwords that the device remembers.
trans-unit.target: Specify the number of previously used passwords that the device remembers.

trans-unit.source: **Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off**<sup>1
trans-unit.target: **Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off**<sup>1

trans-unit.source: Specify the number of minutes before the device display is turned off.
trans-unit.target: Specify the number of minutes before the device display is turned off.

trans-unit.source: Allow fingerprint unlock
trans-unit.target: Allow fingerprint unlock

trans-unit.source: Allow using a fingerprint to unlock the device.
trans-unit.target: Allow using a fingerprint to unlock the device.

trans-unit.source: 1</sup> For iOS devices, when you configure the settings **Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off** and **Minutes of inactivity before password is required**, they are applied in sequence.
trans-unit.target: 1</sup> For iOS devices, when you configure the settings **Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off** and **Minutes of inactivity before password is required**, they are applied in sequence.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you set the value for both settings to **5** minutes, the screen will turn off automatically after 5 minutes, and the device will be locked after an additional 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you set the value for both settings to **5** minutes, the screen will turn off automatically after 5 minutes, and the device will be locked after an additional 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: However, if the user turns off the screen manually, the second setting is immediately applied.
trans-unit.target: However, if the user turns off the screen manually, the second setting is immediately applied.

trans-unit.source: In the same example, after the user turns off the screen, the device will lock 5 minutes later.
trans-unit.target: In the same example, after the user turns off the screen, the device will lock 5 minutes later.

trans-unit.source: System settings
trans-unit.target: System settings

trans-unit.source: All settings apply to iOS 8.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: All settings apply to iOS 8.0 and later.

trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.target: Allow screenshot

trans-unit.target: Allow the user to capture the contents of the screen as an image.

trans-unit.source: Allow control center in lock screen
trans-unit.target: Allow control center in lock screen

trans-unit.source: Allow the user to access the control center app when the device is locked.
trans-unit.target: Allow the user to access the control center app when the device is locked.

trans-unit.source: Allow notification view in lock screen
trans-unit.target: Allow notification view in lock screen

trans-unit.source: Allow the user to access the notifications view without unlocking the device.
trans-unit.target: Allow the user to access the notifications view without unlocking the device.

trans-unit.source: Allow today view in lock screen
trans-unit.target: Allow today view in lock screen

trans-unit.source: Allow the user to view notifications when the device is locked.
trans-unit.target: Allow the user to view notifications when the device is locked.

trans-unit.source: Allow untrusted TLS certificates
trans-unit.target: Allow untrusted TLS certificates

trans-unit.source: Allow untrusted Transport Layer Security certificates on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allow untrusted Transport Layer Security certificates on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allow diagnostic data submission
trans-unit.target: Allow diagnostic data submission

trans-unit.source: Allow or block the device from submitting diagnostic data to Apple.
trans-unit.target: Allow or block the device from submitting diagnostic data to Apple.

trans-unit.source: Allow passbook while locked
trans-unit.target: Allow passbook while locked

trans-unit.source: Allow the user to access the Passbook app while the device is locked.
trans-unit.target: Allow the user to access the Passbook app while the device is locked.

trans-unit.target: Cloud settings for documents and data

trans-unit.source: All settings apply to iOS 8.0 and later.
trans-unit.target: All settings apply to iOS 8.0 and later.

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Allow backup to iCloud
trans-unit.target: Allow backup to iCloud

trans-unit.source: Allow the user to back up the device to iCloud.
trans-unit.target: Allow the user to back up the device to iCloud.

trans-unit.source: Allow document sync to iCloud
trans-unit.target: Allow document sync to iCloud

trans-unit.source: Allow document and key-value synchronization to your iCloud storage space.
trans-unit.target: Allow document and key-value synchronization to your iCloud storage space.

trans-unit.source: Allow Photo Stream sync to iCloud
trans-unit.target: Allow Photo Stream sync to iCloud

trans-unit.source: Allow photos on the device to sync to iCloud.
trans-unit.target: Allow photos on the device to sync to iCloud.

trans-unit.source: Require encrypted backup
trans-unit.target: Require encrypted backup

trans-unit.source: Require any device backups to be encrypted.
trans-unit.target: Require any device backups to be encrypted.

trans-unit.source: Allow managed apps to sync data to iCloud
trans-unit.target: Allow managed apps to sync data to iCloud

trans-unit.source: Allow apps that you manage with Intune to sync data to the user's iCloud account.
trans-unit.target: Allow apps that you manage with Intune to sync data to the user's iCloud account.

trans-unit.source: Allow Handoff to continue activities on another device
trans-unit.target: Allow Handoff to continue activities on another device

trans-unit.source: Allow the user to continue work that they started on an iOS device on another iOS or Mac OS X device.
trans-unit.target: Allow the user to continue work that they started on an iOS device on another iOS or Mac OS X device.

trans-unit.source: Allow iCloud Photo Sharing
trans-unit.target: Allow iCloud Photo Sharing

trans-unit.source: Allow use of the iOS shared photo stream feature.
trans-unit.target: Allow use of the iOS shared photo stream feature.

trans-unit.source: Allow iCloud Photo Library
trans-unit.target: Allow iCloud Photo Library

trans-unit.source: Allow the user to store photos on iCloud.
trans-unit.target: Allow the user to store photos on iCloud.

trans-unit.source: If disabled, any photos already stored on iCloud will be removed.
trans-unit.target: If disabled, any photos already stored on iCloud will be removed.

trans-unit.target: All settings apply to iOS 8.0 and later.

trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Allow installing apps
trans-unit.target: Allow installing apps

trans-unit.source: Allow the device to access the app store and install apps.
trans-unit.target: Allow the device to access the app store and install apps.

trans-unit.source: Require a password to access application store
trans-unit.target: Require a password to access application store

trans-unit.source: Require the user to enter a password before they can visit the app store.
trans-unit.target: Require the user to enter a password before they can visit the app store.

trans-unit.source: Allow in-app purchases
trans-unit.target: Allow in-app purchases

trans-unit.source: Allow store purchases to be made from within a running app.
trans-unit.target: Allow store purchases to be made from within a running app.

trans-unit.source: Allow managed documents in other unmanaged apps
trans-unit.target: Allow managed documents in other unmanaged apps

trans-unit.source: Allow corporate documents to be viewed in any app.
trans-unit.target: Allow corporate documents to be viewed in any app.

trans-unit.source: **Example:** You want to prevent users from saving files from the OneDrive app to Dropbox.
trans-unit.target: **Example:** You want to prevent users from saving files from the OneDrive app to Dropbox.

trans-unit.source: Configure this setting as no.
trans-unit.target: Configure this setting as no.

trans-unit.source: After the device receives the policy (for example, after a restart), it will no longer allow saving.
trans-unit.target: After the device receives the policy (for example, after a restart), it will no longer allow saving.

trans-unit.source: Allow unmanaged documents in other managed apps
trans-unit.target: Allow unmanaged documents in other managed apps

trans-unit.source: Allow any document to be viewed in corporate managed apps.
trans-unit.target: Allow any document to be viewed in corporate managed apps.

trans-unit.source: Allow video conferencing
trans-unit.target: Allow video conferencing

trans-unit.source: Allow video conferencing apps such as FaceTime on the device.
trans-unit.target: Allow video conferencing apps such as FaceTime on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allow the user to trust new enterprise app authors
trans-unit.target: Allow the user to trust new enterprise app authors

trans-unit.source: Lets the user select to trust apps that were not downloaded from the app store.
trans-unit.target: Lets the user select to trust apps that were not downloaded from the app store.

trans-unit.source: Settings for compliant and noncompliant apps
trans-unit.target: Settings for compliant and noncompliant apps

trans-unit.source: In the **Compliant & Noncompliant Apps** list, specify a list of compliant or noncompliant apps by using the following information.
trans-unit.target: In the **Compliant & Noncompliant Apps** list, specify a list of compliant or noncompliant apps by using the following information.

trans-unit.source: A single policy can contain only a list of compliant apps or a list of noncompliant apps.
trans-unit.target: A single policy can contain only a list of compliant apps or a list of noncompliant apps.

trans-unit.source: You cannot specify both in the same policy.
trans-unit.target: You cannot specify both in the same policy.

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Report noncompliance when users install the listed apps
trans-unit.target: Report noncompliance when users install the listed apps

trans-unit.source: List the apps (not managed by Intune) that users are not allowed to install and run.
trans-unit.target: List the apps (not managed by Intune) that users are not allowed to install and run.

trans-unit.source: Report noncompliance when users install apps which are not listed
trans-unit.target: Report noncompliance when users install apps which are not listed

trans-unit.source: List the apps that users are allowed to install.
trans-unit.target: List the apps that users are allowed to install.

trans-unit.source: To remain compliant, users must not install apps that are not listed.
trans-unit.target: To remain compliant, users must not install apps that are not listed.

trans-unit.source: Apps that are managed by Intune are automatically allowed.
trans-unit.target: Apps that are managed by Intune are automatically allowed.

trans-unit.source: Add
trans-unit.target: Add

trans-unit.source: Add an app to the selected list.
trans-unit.target: Add an app to the selected list.

trans-unit.source: Specify a name of your choice, optionally the app publisher, and the URL to the app in the app store.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name of your choice, optionally the app publisher, and the URL to the app in the app store.

trans-unit.source: Read "How to specify URLs to app stores" later in this topic for more help.
trans-unit.target: Read "How to specify URLs to app stores" later in this topic for more help.

trans-unit.source: Import Apps
trans-unit.target: Import Apps

trans-unit.source: Import a list of apps you have specified in a comma-separated values file.
trans-unit.target: Import a list of apps you have specified in a comma-separated values file.

trans-unit.source: In the file, use this format: application name, publisher, app URL.
trans-unit.target: In the file, use this format: application name, publisher, app URL.

trans-unit.source: Edit
trans-unit.target: Edit

trans-unit.source: Edit the name, publisher, and URL of the selected app.
trans-unit.target: Edit the name, publisher, and URL of the selected app.

trans-unit.source: Delete
trans-unit.target: Delete

trans-unit.source: Delete the selected app from the list.
trans-unit.target: Delete the selected app from the list.

trans-unit.source: Kiosk mode settings
trans-unit.target: Kiosk mode settings

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Select a managed app that will be allowed to run when the device is in kiosk mode
trans-unit.target: Select a managed app that will be allowed to run when the device is in kiosk mode

trans-unit.source: Choose **Browse**, and then specify the managed app or app from a store that will be allowed to run when the device is in kiosk mode.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Browse**, and then specify the managed app or app from a store that will be allowed to run when the device is in kiosk mode.

trans-unit.source: No other apps will be allowed to run on the device.
trans-unit.target: No other apps will be allowed to run on the device.

trans-unit.source: For more help, see "How to specify URLs to app stores" later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: For more help, see "How to specify URLs to app stores" later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Allow touch
trans-unit.target: Allow touch

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the touchscreen on the device.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the touchscreen on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allow screen rotation
trans-unit.target: Allow screen rotation

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable changing the screen orientation when the user rotates the device.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable changing the screen orientation when the user rotates the device.

trans-unit.source: Allow volume buttons
trans-unit.target: Allow volume buttons

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the use of the volume buttons on the device.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the use of the volume buttons on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allow ringer switch
trans-unit.target: Allow ringer switch

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the ringer (mute) switch on the device.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the ringer (mute) switch on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allow screen sleep wake button
trans-unit.target: Allow screen sleep wake button

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the screen sleep wake button on the device.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the screen sleep wake button on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allow auto lock
trans-unit.target: Allow auto lock

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable automatic locking of the device.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable automatic locking of the device.

trans-unit.source: Enable mono audio
trans-unit.target: Enable mono audio

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the accessibility setting **Mono audio**.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the accessibility setting **Mono audio**.

trans-unit.source: Enable voice over
trans-unit.target: Enable voice over

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the accessibility setting **VoiceOver**, which reads aloud text on the device display.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the accessibility setting **VoiceOver**, which reads aloud text on the device display.

trans-unit.source: Enable voice over adjustments
trans-unit.target: Enable voice over adjustments

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable voiceover adjustments, which let the user adjust the VoiceOver function (for example, how fast on-screen text is read aloud).
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable voiceover adjustments, which let the user adjust the VoiceOver function (for example, how fast on-screen text is read aloud).

trans-unit.source: Enable zoom
trans-unit.target: Enable zoom

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the **Zoom** accessibility setting, which lets the user use touch to zoom in to the device display.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the **Zoom** accessibility setting, which lets the user use touch to zoom in to the device display.

trans-unit.source: Enable zoom adjustments
trans-unit.target: Enable zoom adjustments

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable zoom adjustments, which let the user adjust the zoom function.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable zoom adjustments, which let the user adjust the zoom function.

trans-unit.source: Enable invert colors
trans-unit.target: Enable invert colors

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the **Invert Colors** accessibility setting, which adjusts the display to help users with visual impairments.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the **Invert Colors** accessibility setting, which adjusts the display to help users with visual impairments.

trans-unit.source: Enable invert colors adjustments
trans-unit.target: Enable invert colors adjustments

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable invert colors adjustments, which let the user adjust the invert colors function.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable invert colors adjustments, which let the user adjust the invert colors function.

trans-unit.source: Enable assistive touch
trans-unit.target: Enable assistive touch

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the **Assistive Touch** accessibility setting, which helps the user perform on-screen gestures that might be difficult for them to perform.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the **Assistive Touch** accessibility setting, which helps the user perform on-screen gestures that might be difficult for them to perform.

trans-unit.source: Enable assistive touch adjustments
trans-unit.target: Enable assistive touch adjustments

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable assistive touch adjustments, which let the user adjust the assistive touch function.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable assistive touch adjustments, which let the user adjust the assistive touch function.

trans-unit.source: Enable speech selection
trans-unit.target: Enable speech selection

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the **Speak Selection** accessibility settings, which can read aloud the text that the user selects.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the **Speak Selection** accessibility settings, which can read aloud the text that the user selects.

trans-unit.source: The following notes apply to kiosk mode settings for iOS devices:
trans-unit.target: The following notes apply to kiosk mode settings for iOS devices:

trans-unit.source: Before you can configure an iOS device for kiosk mode, you must use the [Apple Configurator tool](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator/id434433123?mt=12) or the [Apple Device Enrollment Program](ios-device-enrollment-program-in-microsoft-intune) to put the device into supervised mode.
trans-unit.target: Before you can configure an iOS device for kiosk mode, you must use the [Apple Configurator tool](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator/id434433123?mt=12) or the [Apple Device Enrollment Program](ios-device-enrollment-program-in-microsoft-intune) to put the device into supervised mode.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Apple Configurator tool, see your Apple documentation.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Apple Configurator tool, see your Apple documentation.

trans-unit.source: If the iOS app that you specify is installed after you deploy the configuration policy, the device will not enter kiosk mode until after it is restarted.
trans-unit.target: If the iOS app that you specify is installed after you deploy the configuration policy, the device will not enter kiosk mode until after it is restarted.

trans-unit.source: Reference information for compliant and noncompliant apps
trans-unit.target: Reference information for compliant and noncompliant apps

trans-unit.source: Use the **Noncompliant Apps Report** to view the compliance of allowed and blocked apps.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Noncompliant Apps Report** to view the compliance of allowed and blocked apps.

trans-unit.source: To run the Noncompliant Apps Report
trans-unit.target: To run the Noncompliant Apps Report

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Reports** > **Noncompliant Apps Report**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Reports** > **Noncompliant Apps Report**.

trans-unit.source: Select the device groups that you want to check, select whether you want to check for compliant apps, noncompliant apps, or both, and then choose **View Report**.
trans-unit.target: Select the device groups that you want to check, select whether you want to check for compliant apps, noncompliant apps, or both, and then choose **View Report**.

trans-unit.source: How to specify URLs to app stores
trans-unit.target: How to specify URLs to app stores

trans-unit.source: To specify an app URL in the compliant and noncompliant apps list, or in the **Select a managed app that will be allowed to run when the device is in kiosk mode** option (iOS only), use the following format:
trans-unit.target: To specify an app URL in the compliant and noncompliant apps list, or in the **Select a managed app that will be allowed to run when the device is in kiosk mode** option (iOS only), use the following format:

trans-unit.source: Using a search engine, find the app that you want to use in the iTunes App Store and open the page for the app.
trans-unit.target: Using a search engine, find the app that you want to use in the iTunes App Store and open the page for the app.

trans-unit.source: Copy the URL of the page and use this as the URL to configure the compliant or noncompliant apps list or the app that you want to run in kiosk mode.
trans-unit.target: Copy the URL of the page and use this as the URL to configure the compliant or noncompliant apps list or the app that you want to run in kiosk mode.

trans-unit.source: **Example:** Search for **Microsoft Word for iPad**.
trans-unit.target: **Example:** Search for **Microsoft Word for iPad**.

trans-unit.source: The URL that you use will be **https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-word-for-ipad/id586447913?mt=8**.
trans-unit.target: The URL that you use will be **https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-word-for-ipad/id586447913?mt=8**.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the iTunes software to find the app and then use the **Copy Link** command to get the app URL.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the iTunes software to find the app and then use the **Copy Link** command to get the app URL.

trans-unit.target: Supervised mode settings

trans-unit.target: You can configure the following settings on devices running iOS 8.0 and later that are in supervised mode.

trans-unit.source: Supervised mode settings for device restrictions
trans-unit.target: Supervised mode settings for device restrictions

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Allow account modification
trans-unit.target: Allow account modification

trans-unit.source: Allow the user to change account settings such as email configurations.
trans-unit.target: Allow the user to change account settings such as email configurations.

trans-unit.target: Allow changes to app cellular data usage settings

trans-unit.source: Allow the user to control which apps are allowed to use cellular data.
trans-unit.target: Allow the user to control which apps are allowed to use cellular data.

trans-unit.target: Allow the use of the erase all content and settings option on the device

trans-unit.target: Allow the user to use the option of erasing all content and settings on the device.

trans-unit.source: Allow the user to enable restrictions in the device settings
trans-unit.target: Allow the user to enable restrictions in the device settings

trans-unit.target: Allow the user to configure device restrictions (parental controls) on the device.

trans-unit.target: Allow host pairing to control the devices an iOS device can pair with

trans-unit.target: Allow host pairing to let the administrator control which devices an iOS device can pair with.

trans-unit.target: Allow the user to install configuration profiles and certificates

trans-unit.target: Allow the user to install configuration profiles and certificates.

trans-unit.target: Allow device name modification

trans-unit.target: Allow passcode modification

trans-unit.target: Allow Siri to query user-generated content from the Internet

trans-unit.target: Allow Spotlight search to return results from the Internet

trans-unit.target: Allow keyboard spell-check

trans-unit.source: Show or Hide Apps
trans-unit.target: Show or Hide Apps

trans-unit.source: Use the **Hidden and shown apps list** to control the following on supervised devices running iOS 9.3 or later:
trans-unit.target: Use the **Hidden and shown apps list** to control the following on supervised devices running iOS 9.3 or later:

trans-unit.source: Specify a list of apps that will be hidden from users.
trans-unit.target: Specify a list of apps that will be hidden from users.

trans-unit.source: Users cannot view, or launch these apps.
trans-unit.target: Users cannot view, or launch these apps.

trans-unit.source: Specify a list of apps that users can view and launch.
trans-unit.target: Specify a list of apps that users can view and launch.

trans-unit.source: No other apps can be viewed or launched.
trans-unit.target: No other apps can be viewed or launched.

trans-unit.source: How to create a hidden or shown app list
trans-unit.target: How to create a hidden or shown app list

trans-unit.source: Specify the following settings:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following settings:

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Hidden and shown apps list
trans-unit.target: Hidden and shown apps list

trans-unit.source: Enable this setting if you want to create a hidden, or shown apps list.
trans-unit.target: Enable this setting if you want to create a hidden, or shown apps list.

trans-unit.source: Hide the listed apps from users
trans-unit.target: Hide the listed apps from users

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you want to create a list of apps that will be hidden from users.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you want to create a list of apps that will be hidden from users.

trans-unit.source: Show only the listed apps to users
trans-unit.target: Show only the listed apps to users

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you want to create a list of apps that are displayed to users.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you want to create a list of apps that are displayed to users.

trans-unit.source: When you create this list type, all other apps except for the iOS **Settings** and **Phone** (for iPhones) apps are hidden.
trans-unit.target: When you create this list type, all other apps except for the iOS **Settings** and **Phone** (for iPhones) apps are hidden.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you must add the Company Portal, and any apps you have deployed, and manage with Intune to the list.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you must add the Company Portal, and any apps you have deployed, and manage with Intune to the list.

trans-unit.source: Add
trans-unit.target: Add

trans-unit.source: Adds an app to the selected list.
trans-unit.target: Adds an app to the selected list.

trans-unit.source: For the hidden list, you must specify the **Name**, **Publisher**, and **App URL or Bundle ID** of each app you want to hide.
trans-unit.target: For the hidden list, you must specify the **Name**, **Publisher**, and **App URL or Bundle ID** of each app you want to hide.

trans-unit.source: For the shown list, you can either **Select a managed app** which gives you a list of apps you manage with Intune to select from, or Select a store app, after which you must specify the **Name**, **Publisher**, and **App URL or Bundle ID** of each app you want to display.
trans-unit.target: For the shown list, you can either **Select a managed app** which gives you a list of apps you manage with Intune to select from, or Select a store app, after which you must specify the **Name**, **Publisher**, and **App URL or Bundle ID** of each app you want to display.

trans-unit.source: Import Apps
trans-unit.target: Import Apps

trans-unit.source: Imports a list of apps you have specified in a comma-separated values file.
trans-unit.target: Imports a list of apps you have specified in a comma-separated values file.

trans-unit.source: Use the format, application name, publisher, app URL in the file.
trans-unit.target: Use the format, application name, publisher, app URL in the file.

trans-unit.source: Edit
trans-unit.target: Edit

trans-unit.source: Let’s you edit the name, publisher and URL of the selected app.
trans-unit.target: Let’s you edit the name, publisher and URL of the selected app.

trans-unit.source: Delete
trans-unit.target: Delete

trans-unit.source: Deletes the selected app from the list.
trans-unit.target: Deletes the selected app from the list.

trans-unit.source: App information for built-in iOS apps
trans-unit.target: App information for built-in iOS apps

trans-unit.source: Use the information in this list to identify the name, publisher, and bundle ID of the built-in iOS apps that you might want to show or hide.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in this list to identify the name, publisher, and bundle ID of the built-in iOS apps that you might want to show or hide.

trans-unit.source: If you want to show or hide all of the apps in the list, you can copy the data below into a text file with the extension **.csv**, then use the **Import Apps** option to import all of the apps simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: If you want to show or hide all of the apps in the list, you can copy the data below into a text file with the extension **.csv**, then use the **Import Apps** option to import all of the apps simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: Custom policy settings
trans-unit.target: Custom policy settings

trans-unit.source: Use the Microsoft Intune **iOS custom policy** to deploy settings that you created by using the [Apple Configurator tool](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator/id434433123?mt=12) to iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: Use the Microsoft Intune **iOS custom policy** to deploy settings that you created by using the [Apple Configurator tool](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator/id434433123?mt=12) to iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: This tool lets you create many settings that control the operation of these devices and export them to a configuration profile.
trans-unit.target: This tool lets you create many settings that control the operation of these devices and export them to a configuration profile.

trans-unit.source: You can then import this configuration profile into an Intune iOS custom policy and deploy the settings to users and devices in your organization.
trans-unit.target: You can then import this configuration profile into an Intune iOS custom policy and deploy the settings to users and devices in your organization.

trans-unit.source: This capability allows you to deploy iOS settings that are not configurable with Intune general configuration policies.
trans-unit.target: This capability allows you to deploy iOS settings that are not configurable with Intune general configuration policies.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you start, you must have installed the Apple Configurator and created a configuration file that contains the settings that you want to deploy to users or devices.
trans-unit.target: Before you start, you must have installed the Apple Configurator and created a configuration file that contains the settings that you want to deploy to users or devices.

trans-unit.source: You can download and learn about the Apple Configurator from [the Mac App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator/id434433123?mt=12).
trans-unit.target: You can download and learn about the Apple Configurator from [the Mac App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/apple-configurator/id434433123?mt=12).

trans-unit.source: Intune does not report the compliance of individual settings in an iOS custom policy.
trans-unit.target: Intune does not report the compliance of individual settings in an iOS custom policy.

trans-unit.source: However, the overall compliance of the policy is reported.
trans-unit.target: However, the overall compliance of the policy is reported.

trans-unit.source: General settings
trans-unit.target: General settings

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the iOS custom policy to help you identify it in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the iOS custom policy to help you identify it in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the iOS custom policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
trans-unit.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the iOS custom policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

trans-unit.source: Custom settings
trans-unit.target: Custom settings

trans-unit.source: Setting name
trans-unit.target: Setting name

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Custom configuration profile name (displayed to users)
trans-unit.target: Custom configuration profile name (displayed to users)

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for the policy as it will be displayed on the device, and in Intune policy reports.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for the policy as it will be displayed on the device, and in Intune policy reports.

trans-unit.source: Configuration profile file
trans-unit.target: Configuration profile file

trans-unit.source: Choose **Import**, and then browse to the configuration profile that you created by using the Apple Configurator.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Import**, and then browse to the configuration profile that you created by using the Apple Configurator.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** Ensure that the settings you export from the Apple Configurator tool are compatible with the version of iOS on the devices to which you deploy the iOS custom policy.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** Ensure that the settings you export from the Apple Configurator tool are compatible with the version of iOS on the devices to which you deploy the iOS custom policy.

trans-unit.source: For information about how incompatible settings are resolved, search for **Configuration Profile Reference** and **Mobile Device Management Protocol Reference** on the [Apple Developer](https://developer.apple.com/) website.
trans-unit.target: For information about how incompatible settings are resolved, search for **Configuration Profile Reference** and **Mobile Device Management Protocol Reference** on the [Apple Developer](https://developer.apple.com/) website.

trans-unit.source: Configuration profile details
trans-unit.target: Configuration profile details

trans-unit.source: Display the XML code for the configuration profile that you imported.
trans-unit.target: Display the XML code for the configuration profile that you imported.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies
trans-unit.target: Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies
